title: County mulls $4M restoration of Kensico Dam reflecting pool
text:
County mulls $4M restoration of Kensico Dam reflecting pool Mark Lungariello , mlungariel@lohud.com 7:49 a.m. EDT October 10, 2015 If restored, the reflecting pool could become an ice skating rink in the winter. Kensico Dam in Valhalla June 21, 2011. ( Frank Becerra Jr. / The Journal News ) (Photo: Frank Becerra Jr.,Staff) 29 CONNECT 7 TWEET LINKEDIN 1 COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
Westchester County is considering a $4 million construction project that would restore the reflecting pool at the base of the dam at Kenisco Dam Plaza in Valhalla. 
The project would include reconfigured water-circulation systems and plumbing that would put back into use the now-dry pool as well as fountains and cascades. 
A recent residents’ preference study showed Kensico Plaza is the most recognized park facility in the county and is used by nearly 200,000 people a year, according to the county. Heritage events, food festivals and other events are regularly held at the plaza during the summer months. 
Beginning next month, the plaza will host its second “Winter Wonderland” festivities, which includes a 70-by-90-foot ice skating rink near the unused basin. Years ago, when the water in the reflecting pool froze over it was used for ice skating. 
Elena Rogliano, a spokeswoman for Westchester County Executive Rob Astorin, said if repairs are completed, the county could potentially use the pool as a skating rink again – either by natural freezing of the surface or by using compressors to freeze the ice. 
Design and construction are estimated to take 13 months if the county Legislature approves the spending. 
A proposal to bond for the cost is set to be discussed in legislative committees and would need approval there before it is sent to the entire Board of Legislators for a vote. 29 CONNECT 7 TWEET LINKEDIN 1 COMMENT EMAIL MORE Read or Share this story: http://lohud.us/1RtvM1Z TOP VIDEOS
